website_summaries.verdict: A great option for any player wanting a game that continues one of Nintendo's most popular lines.
pros: Modern level design offers more engaging gameplay than previous iterations of the Super Mario Bros games
It brings characters from the classic games with the 3DS updated graphics
cons: The controls and goals for the game can be a bit confusing for younger kids

customer_reviews.title: Fun platformer from the franchise we know and love
customer_reviews.text: Mario 2 is far better than the original Mario DS. The original was fun with the traditional platform style of play that we have all come to know and enjoy throughout the Mario franchise, but Mario 2 has a lot more action and color. Some of the annoying things from the original were removed, like you can now save again and again after beating a tower or castle. The annoying chomping sounds from the piranha plants is also gone. In this game, you focus more on getting coins while also collecting the three big gold coins, finding secret levels, and beating Bowser. I've gotten a lot of extra lives just from all the coins I collected.
customer_reviews.author: Gibble Fish

customer_reviews.title: Comes used with no booklet or case! Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: Got the game. It came shipped in a small envelope with a slip of paper saying it was used but that it was tested and worked fine. No case, no insert, just the little cartridge by itself. I purchased this game under the impression that it was new. Item description didn't say it was used but I paid the price for a new one. Not having the case decreases the games value. I'm not happy at all. This looked like a little used piece from GameStop. Should've been in a case with the little booklet. These people just haggled me to get more money.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Money is the name of the game
customer_reviews.text: This might be the only Mario platformer you can certifiably qualify as a scam. The New Super Mario Bros. titles are already soulless cash cows compared to their 3D counterparts, mining your nostalgia without any difference between the games (they all have the same soundtrack and world archetypes), but this particular entry is especially lazy, with bland and wide-open stages. The return of the Raccoon Leaf is wasted on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R

customer_reviews.title: Super Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I loved the first Super Mario Bros. game so much I decided to get the next one! The story is almost exactly the same as the first game with a few changes. You have more bosses to beat, and you also have a few new special moves/abilities, which is nice. Over all I play my Super Mario Bros. games to relax and they are perfect for it! It's not too detailed to where the game is hard but it's still detailed enough to keep your brain working. I hope there's more Mario Bros. games coming soon!
customer_reviews.author: Abbie W

customer_reviews.title: 100% Recommend to mario fans
customer_reviews.text: I love this game.. Super fun to play. I dont remember if it was used or new but I think it was used cause there was no plastic wrap on it. But it olays great and looks brand new in nox with everything. No wear or tear either. But its super fun to play! Definitely recommend 👌
customer_reviews.author: Megan Tice

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: I am Venezuelan ... I get the product faster than was offered to box the company was going to move to my country, I am very pleased ... arrived in perfect condition and well deserves thanks and all know what I recommend to buy with confidence'm in another country and the product is such that it has to offer, thank you, very pleased .. worth buying from amazon
customer_reviews.author: karen july

customer_reviews.title: Good but only if you don't already have WiiU version of game
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old's feedback: Good game. Only 4 out of 5 stars because it is kind of like Super Mario Bros WiiU - a little bit repetitive. If you have the WiiU version, this game is exactly the same.
customer_reviews.author: RiDaveAmazon

customer_reviews.title: New(er) Mario games are more like the spirit of the older (better) ones!
customer_reviews.text: WowWowWow! If you love Mario, platformers, and side scrolling....than this will not let you down. Many pluses - It keeps track of every coin collected no matter what mode you play in. You can play with a second person. And even after finishing the game the coin rush battles keep me coming back for more. I own many 3ds games and this is one that is always being played... I love the streetpass challenges lately. Another perfect Mario game! Super Mario Bros. 3 is my all time favorite video game for many years, but this is very similar in fun and play control. I will probably always love Mario anytime this happens. Raccoon Tail, Yeah!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Burton

customer_reviews.title: WAY too much fun
customer_reviews.text: This game is close to being a perfect Mario title. It's fun and challenging (sometimes frustratingly so), but stands out as a game full of colorful characters and backgrounds while also holding a treasure trove full of secrets to be unlocked. Highly recommended! (Just don't throw your 3DS on the ground when you get frustrated!)
customer_reviews.author: jb512512

customer_reviews.title: Love me some Mario
customer_reviews.text: This is a great typical Mario bros game. It's like much of the other Mario Bros games so it's fun, familiar but different. I love the coin rush levels just a fun thing to play to help you reach that million coin goal. As far as the prize being not so great, granted its not some huge thing but it was a lotta fun to get to a million coins and to see your little coin counter go up and it still counts even after you've collected the million so that's really kool too. I still think it was a fun game and I've all ready beaten it twice just for the fun of it.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game with Much Replayability
customer_reviews.text: This game is one of my favorite Mario games yet! The game is very generous with coins and 1-UPS. My favorite power up is the Golden Fire Flower because you can turn bricks into coins. This game is remarkably similar to Super Mario Bros 3 and Super Mario World with power ups such as the raccoon leaf, and backup boss music that sounds like an updated version of SMB 3
customer_reviews.author: Steve Kay

customer_reviews.title: Average Mario game; doesn't do much new
customer_reviews.text: This game is a pretty formulaic Mario game - it plays decently, but it mostly retreats the same ground other Marios do. If you're new to Mario games, I recommend Super Mario Bros, Super Mario Bros 3, or Super Mario World to start with (there's also Super Mario Bros 2, but it isn't as good). Or if you want to play with friends, New Super Mario Bros U or Super Luigi U are great games. There's one for the Wii as well, but I haven't played it. Really hardcore Mario fans might like this, but for everyone else, stay away.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: It's a Mario game... Do you need a review?
customer_reviews.text: If you liked New Super Mario Bros, then you'll love more of the same! The naming that they used for the DS and 3DS versions of Mario are confusing, but this is the sequel to New Super Mario Bros for the DS. I find it to be much of the same. I do not find the more recent titles to be as difficult as the originals, but they are pretty. I will admit that 2 has VERY hidden secrets and coin stars which make for a higher level of replayability. I enjoyed my time with the game and, much like any other Mario game, I look forward to picking it back up a couple years and playing it again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Abels

customer_reviews.title: great condition for entire product.
customer_reviews.text: Came 5 days early. Case game and manual in pristine condition. Thanks for helping my daughter buy a game for a good price. Thank you thank you thank you

customer_reviews.title: Lot's of coins
customer_reviews.text: On the surface, New Super Mario Bros. 2 came of to me as more of the same so I waited to buy it. I wouldn't say I regret waiting but perhaps I underestimated how much I was going to enjoy this new adventure. There really is quite of few new additions and the 3D effect is a nice touch. You collect a lot of coins and can get over 99 lives for the first time (I think). Probably something that any Mario Bros. fan should have and maybe should've been a day one purchase for me.

customer_reviews.title: Super easy, but fun. Difficult packs in DLC.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game that has a fun "coin-rush" mode that adds a lot of playtime beyond the main campaign. The story mode itself is super easy, but there are DLC packs you can buy that are very difficult for those who are masochistic. This is probably the best integration of the 3DS's StreetPass feature I've seen in a game so far. Would recommend to fans of the NSMB series.

customer_reviews.title: What you'd expect from Mario Bros.

Both kids can play each other while using "co-op play" but you will need two separate games and wi-fi. Not many games can do this on the DS but this one can. I think the kids would give it a zillion stars if they could.

customer_reviews.title: Almost the same as the first NSMB, but fun anyways.
customer_reviews.text: I was doubtful as to buy this game. However, it turned out to be a great idea. The game itself looks almost the same as the first version. But having different stages, and some modifications in the items you can get, feels like another new game. If you are a hardcore fan of Mario Games, get it. If you want an all new Mario game, skit it. You will feel like you wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Good Game
customer_reviews.text: This New Mario is more than ever a gold-hungry race. There's not much novelty there, but an almost shoot'em up like approach to patterns and skill in order to reach the goal of 1 million coins. But the game remains easy, it seems like even Nintendo itself doesn't care that much anymore for pushing the boundaries of game design and appearing different.

customer_reviews.title: The classic just continues to amaze
customer_reviews.text: Having played 8-bit Super Mario 20+ years ago, I jumped at the chance to enjoy this version with my 7-year-old son, even delighting in the fact that the names hadn't really changed and most of the 'skills' (like jumping on turtles and grabbing coins) were still relevant. Low on video game violence, high on problem solving, this game is a winner!

customer_reviews.title: Geriatric Game Player
customer_reviews.text: It made my grandson (age 7) very happy. I used to play orig Mario Bros and look forward to playing this with him after New Years so he'll teach me all the clues etc. Next year will be fifty years of computer experience for me and nothing thrills me more than watching him accept at face what I helped pioneer, program, design and sell.He knows I was the first to color print from an IBM 360 in 1967; decades before color printers were avail. It was an orange pumpkin for Halloween 1967. Yes I am an antique in PCs and Internet too.

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my fiance for Christmas, and he was absolutely thrilled. He's generously sharing the game, and we both really enjoy playing it.
customer_reviews.author: Kryssa

customer_reviews.title: this new game is just way too easy.
customer_reviews.text: For somebody who has played mario 1, 2, and 3 on the original NES, this new game is just way too easy.
customer_reviews.author: Penn Name

product_meta.title: New Super Mario Bros. 2
product_meta.description:
NEW SUPER MARIO BROS. 2 FOR NINTENDO 3DS
Feel the rush of discovering tons of coins in brand new coin-rich worlds with the new Gold Mario, gold pipes, gold Fire Flowers, new block head Mario that transforms enemies into coins, and while challenging your friends in the new Coin Rush Mode. Can you get one million coins?

FEATURES
 * New Super Mario Bros. 2 is an all-new side-scrolling adventure game featuring Mario and Luigi. Two players who each own the game will have the option to play the entire game in two-player multiplayer mode using local wireless.
 * The game records all the coins players collect throughout the game, so completing a level is only part of the fun. Every level is filled with golden opportunities, such as gold rings that turn enemies into valuable gold versions and a Gold Flower that gives Mario the ability to turn almost anything in his path into coins.
 * Coin Rush Mode allows players to collect as many coins as possible across three levels and challenge friends to beat their record via StreetPass.
 * The return of Raccoon Mario gives Mario the ability to fly and access hidden areas.
 * Utilize a wide range of new and returning power-ups and items spread throughout the game world.



AMAZON.COM


 New Super Mario Bros. 2 is a side-scrolling Platformer video game for Nintendo 3DS. A sequel to the 2006 Nintendo DS release, New Super Mario Bros., this new game version challenges players to rescue Princess Peach from the latest kidnapping by Bowser, and to collect as masses of Nintendo gold coins while doing so. Of all Mario titles released to date, New Super Mario Bros. 2 contains the the greatest emphasis on gold collection, with over a million coins available throughout the game's 80+ stages. Additional game features include: wireless co-op multiplayer support, new and returning power-ups and hidden items, and SpotPass automatic download functionality for the wireless sharing of information with friends. 

A whole new battle against Bowser in which gold coins are key.
View larger New and returning power-ups that dramatically affect Mario's platforming abilities.
View larger MARIO HITS THE MUSHROOM KINGDOM JACKPOT
 Bowser has once again kidnapped Princess Peach, but besides rescuing his lady love, this time Mario has another objective. The Mushroom Kingdom is bursting with more gold coins than ever before. Each level is littered with gold as coins rain down from overhead pipes, trails of coins are left behind special gold enemies and gold pipes transport Mario into coin-filled caverns. It's up to players to collect as many coins as possible throughout their adventure. 

ENJOY THE PLATFORMING FUN WITH A FRIEND
 New Super Mario Bros. 2 allows players to share the fast-paced fun with a friend over a local wireless network. The game's 2-player co-op mode requires both players to have a Nintendo 3DS system and a copy of the game. Together players can play through the entire game, collect double the coins, team up to unleash devastating double Ground Pound attacks on enemies, and more. An extra player can even help when continuing from your solo play save file. 

COLLECT, LITERALLY A MILLION COINS
 Coin collection is important in every adventure in the Mushroom Kingdom, but New Super Mario Bros. 2 takes this to new heights. The game is filled with more coins and gold-related features than any Mario game before, and includes the frenzied Coin Rush mode in which you play three levels back to back trying to earn as many coins as possible. In fact, the game literally holds more than a million possible coins, and keeps track of each for you as you proceed from beginning to end. SpotPass functionality built into the 3DS allows you to share your running total with friends. If you reach a million coins, you'll get something special. 

KEY GAME FEATURES
 * New Super Mario Bros. 2 is an all-new side-scrolling adventure game featuring Mario and Luigi. Two players who each own the game will have the option to play the entire game in two-player multiplayer mode using local wireless.
 * The game records all the coins players collect throughout the game, so completing a level is only part of the fun. Every level is filled with golden opportunities, such as gold rings that turn enemies into valuable gold versions and a Gold Flower that gives Mario the ability to turn almost anything in his path into coins.
 * Coin Rush Mode allows players to collect as many coins as possible across three levels and challenge friends to beat their record via StreetPass.
 * The return of Raccoon Mario gives Mario the ability to fly and access hidden areas.
 * Utilize a wide range of new and returning power-ups and items spread throughout the game world.

ADDITIONAL SCREENSHOTS
Team up in wireless co-op play.
View larger Take flight as Raccoon Mario.
View larger Create your own gold.
View larger Explore familiar environments.
